title: Here's a reading list of 20 articles on the interpretability of transformer models, covering various aspects such as attention mechanisms, visualization techniques, and case studies. These articles span from foundational works to the most recent advancements up to

author.literal: **Attention is All You Need** - Vaswani et al.

title: The seminal paper introducing the Transformer model
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding** - Devlin et al
Introduces BERT and discusses its interpretability aspects
**Visualizing and Understanding Neural Models in NLP** - Li et al
Early work on visualizing attention mechanisms in neural networks
**A Closer Look at the Robustness and Interpretability of Deep Learning Models**
Discusses robustness and interpretability in deep learning, including transformers

author.literal: **Analyzing and Interpreting BERT** - Clark et al.

title: A detailed analysis of what BERT learns and how to interpret it
**Attention is Not Explanation**
Critiques the use of attention weights as explanations
**Dissecting Transformers: Understanding the Inner Workings of Transformer Models**
Analyzes the internal mechanisms of transformers
**Interpretable Multi-Head Self-Attention via Visual Analytics** - Liu et al
Proposes visual analytics techniques for interpreting multi-head self-attention
**Towards a Rigorous Science of Interpretable Machine Learning**
Discusses the broader context of interpretability in machine learning, relevant to transformers
**Transformer Interpretability Beyond Attention Visualization** - Chefer et al
Explores interpretability techniques beyond simple attention visualization
**Explaining Transformers' Predictions: An Empirical Study** - Vig et al
Empirical study on explaining predictions made by transformer models
**The Building Blocks of Interpretability** - Olah et al
Discusses interpretability in neural networks, including transformers
**Towards Interpretable NLP with Attention Attribution and Visualization**
Focuses on attention attribution methods for interpretability

author.literal: **Explaining BERT with SHAP** - Lundberg et al.

title: Applies SHAP values to interpret BERT models
**Interpretability in the Wild: A Circuit for Indirect Object Identification in GPT-2**
Case study on interpretability in GPT-2
**Understanding and Improving Transformer From a Multi-Particle Dynamic System Point of View**
Provides a novel perspective on understanding transformers
**Towards Transparent and Explainable Attention Models**
Investigates the transparency and explainability of attention models
**Interpretability of Transformer Models via Input Reduction** - Li et al
Proposes input reduction as a method for interpreting transformers
**Interpretable and Explainable Transformers: A Survey** - Lin et al
A comprehensive survey of interpretability and explainability techniques for transformers
**Explaining Transformers in a Human-Friendly Way** - Zhang et al
Recent advancements in making transformer explanations more accessible to non-experts
These articles should provide a solid foundation and up-to-date insights into the interpretability of transformer models
